page.title: 12THE HOLMS OF IRE
page.content: There are 2 holms (tidal islets), the {"Outer Holm"}and the{"Inner Holm"}both stretching out from the north_west tip of Burness.Each one is joined by tidal rocks which are covered at high tide making it possible to cross at low tide only.Every person in Burness has an equal claim to the Holms but at this moment{Mr.J.Dearness}of{Scar}has sheep grazing there.The{Inner Holm}is smaller than the{Outer Holm}in width and length.Together they stretch for 2 miles.There are many buildings there made from stone,one of them being a small chapel where{St.Columba}was supposed to have sent his missionaries The other buildings are small shepherd shelters where they stayed until it was possible to get back across.It is now a very isolated place where there are thousands of{sea birds.}
